intro: Mesembryanthemum micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly ornamental species. The plant features fleshy, ribbed stems and small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Mesembryanthemum micranthum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
